sect2.para: BusyBox combines tiny versions of many common UNIX utilities into a single small executable. It provides replacements for most of the utilities you usually find in GNU fileutils, shellutils, etc. The utilities in BusyBox generally have fewer options than their full-featured GNU cousins; however, the options that are included provide the expected functionality and behave very much like their GNU counterparts.

sect2.title: Installation of BusyBox
sect2.para: First install some patches to fix various bugs that have been addressed upstream:
Ensure the BusyBox source is completely clean:
Disable RPC support because of issues when building against Glibc:

screen.userinput: sed -e 's/\(CONFIG_FEATURE_HAVE_RPC\)=y/# \1 is not set/' \ -e 's/\(CONFIG_FEATURE_INETD_RPC\)=y/# \1 is not set/' -i .config

sect2.para: Instead of using the default DES method, use the more secure SHA-512 method of password encryption:
Disable simplified modutils and enable standard utilities for loading kernel modules:

screen.userinput: sed -e 's/\(CONFIG_MODPROBE_SMALL\)=y/# \1 is not set/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_INSMOD\) is not set/\1=y/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_RMMOD\) is not set/\1=y/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_LSMOD\) is not set/\1=y/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_FEATURE_LSMOD_PRETTY_2_6_OUTPUT\) is not set/\1=y/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_MODPROBE\) is not set/\1=y/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_FEATURE_MODPROBE_BLACKLIST\) is not set/\1=y/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_DEPMOD\) is not set/\1=y/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_FEATURE_CHECK_TAINTED_MODULE\) is not set/\1=y/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_FEATURE_MODUTILS_ALIAS\) is not set/\1=y/' \ -e 's/# \(CONFIG_FEATURE_MODUTILS_SYMBOLS\) is not set/\1=y/' -i .config

install -v -m 755 busybox /bin && ln -sv busybox /bin/ash && ln -sv busybox /bin/bunzip2 && ln -sv busybox /bin/bzip2 && ln -sv busybox /bin/dd && ln -sv busybox /bin/df && ln -sv busybox /bin/dnsdomainname && ln -sv busybox /bin/fuser && ln -sv busybox /bin/gunzip && ln -sv busybox /bin/gzip && ln -sv busybox /bin/hostname && ln -sv busybox /bin/hush && ln -sv busybox /bin/kill && ln -sv busybox /bin/ls && ln -sv busybox /bin/mknod && ln -sv busybox /bin/more && ln -sv busybox /bin/mount && ln -sv busybox /bin/netstat && ln -sv busybox /bin/ping && ln -sv busybox /bin/ping6 && ln -sv busybox /bin/ps && ln -sv busybox /bin/sed && ln -sfv busybox /bin/sh && ln -sfv busybox /bin/stty && ln -sv busybox /bin/su && ln -sv busybox /bin/tar && ln -sv busybox /bin/vi && ln -sv busybox /bin/zcat && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/depmod && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/fdisk && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/findfs && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/fsck.minix && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/fstrim && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/getty && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/hwclock && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/init && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/ip && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/klogd && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/mdev && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/mkfs.minix && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/modprobe && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/route && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/runlevel && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/sulogin && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/swapoff && ln -sv ../bin/busybox /sbin/swapon && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/base64 && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/chrt && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/dc && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/diff && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/du && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/expr && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/find && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/flock && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/fold && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/getopt && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/groups && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/hd && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/head && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/hexdump && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/hostid && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/ionice && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/install && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/ipcrm && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/ipcs && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/last && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/less && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/linux32 && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/linux64 && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/logger && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/lzcat && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/lzma && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/man && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/pgrep && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/pkill && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/printf && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/pstree && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/script && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/scriptreplay && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/setarch && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/sha256sum && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/sha3sum && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/sha512sum && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/shuf && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/sort && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/sum && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/tail && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/telnet && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/test && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/tftp && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/top && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/tr && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/traceroute && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/traceroute6 && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/unexpand && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/unlzma && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/unxz && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/unzip && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/users && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/vlock && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/wall && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/bin/watch && ln -sv /usr/sbin/acpid && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/addgroup && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/adduser && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/chpasswd && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/delgroup && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/deluser && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/fdformat && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/ftpd && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/inetd && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/ntpd && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/readprofile && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/rtcwake && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/syslogd && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/telnetd && ln -sv ../../bin/busybox /usr/sbin/tftpd

sect2.title: Configuration
sect2.para: Create a new /etc/syslog.conf file by running the following:

screen.userinput:
cat > /etc/syslog.conf << "EOF" # Begin /etc/syslog.conf
auth,authpriv.* /var/log/auth.log *.*;auth,authpriv.none /var/log/sys.log daemon.* /var/log/daemon.log kern.* /var/log/kern.log mail.* /var/log/mail.log user.* /var/log/user.log *.emerg *
# End /etc/syslog.conf EOF

seglistitem.seg: acpid, addgroup, adduser, ash, base64, bunzip2, busybox, bzip2, chpasswd, chrt, dc, dd, delgroup, deluser, depmod, df, diff, dnsdomainname, du, expr, fdformat, fdisk, find, findfs, flock, fold, fsck.minix, fstrim, ftpd, fuser, getopt, getty, groups, gunzip, gzip, hd, head, hexdump, hostid, hostname, hush, hwclock, inetd, init, install, ionice, ip, ipcrm, ipcs, kill, klogd, last, less, linux32, linux64, logger, ls, lzcat, lzma, man, mdev, mkfs.minix, mknod, modprobe, more, mount, netstat, ntpd, pgrep, ping, ping6, pkill, printf, ps, pstree, readprofile, route, rtcwake, runlevel, script, scriptreplay, sed, setarch, sh, sha256sum, sha3sum, sha512sum, shuf, sort, stty, su, sulogin, sum, swapoff, swapon, syslogd, tail, tar, telnet, telnetd, test, tftp, tftpd, top, tr, traceroute, traceroute6, unexpand, unlzma, unxz, unzip, users, vi, vlock, wall, watch, wget, whois, xz, xzcat, and zcat

listitem.para: Listens to ACPI events and spawns specific helpers on event arrival.
Creates a new group or adds a user to a group with the given name.
Creates a new user or adds a user to a group with the given name.
Is the most complete and most pedantically correct shell included with BusyBox.
Encodes and decodes data according to the RFC 3548 specification.
Decompresses bzipped files.
Combines many common Unix utilities into a single executable.
Compresses files with bzip2 algorithm.
Updates user passwords in batch mode.
Changes scheduling priority and class for a process.
Is a tiny reverse polish notation calculator.
Copies a file with converting and formatting.
Deletes a group from the system or a user from a group with the given name.
Deletes a user with the given name from the system.
Creates a dependency file based on the symbols it finds in the existing set of kernel modules.
Prints file system usage statistics.
Compares files line by line and outputs the differences between them.
Shows domain part of the system's fully qualified host name.
Summarizes disk space used for each file and/or directory.
Evaluates expressions.
Formats a floppy disk.
Manipulates the paritition table of the given device.
Searches for files and performs actions on them.
Finds a file system based on a label or UUID.
Acquires a file lock and then executes a command with the lock held.
Wraps the lines in the given files.
Checks MINIX file system.
Discards unused blocks on a mounted filesystem.
Is an anonymous FTP server.
Finds processes which use given files or ports.
Parses options in the given command line.
Opens a tty port, prompts for a login name, and then invokes the login program.
Reports the group memberships of user.
Decompresses gzipped files.
Compresses files with gzip algorithm.
Is an alias for hexdump -C.
Prints the first ten lines of each given file.
Dumps the given file in hexadecimal or in another given format.
Reports the numeric identifier of the host.
Shows or sets system host name.
Is a small shell interpreter.
Reads or sets the system's hardware clock.
Listens for network connections and launches programs.
Is the first process started during boot.
Copies files and sets attributes.
Gets or sets I/O priority and class for a program.
Shows and manipulates network routing, devices, policy routing and tunnel.
Removes the given Inter-Process Communication resource.
Provides IPC status information.
Sends signals to processes.
Intercepts and logs kernel messages.
Shows listing of the last users that logged into the system.
Views files or stdin one screenful at a time.
Changes reported architecture to 32bit and sets linux32 personality flags.
Changes reported architecture to 64bit and sets linux64 personality flags.
Writes the given message into the system log.
Lists directory contents.
Decompresses LZMA compressed files to standard output.
Compresses or decompresses files using the LZMA format.
Formats and displays manual page.
Creates and dynamically updates device files.
Creates MINIX file systems.
Creates device nodes with the given names.
Uses a dependency file, created by depmod, to automatically load relevant modules.
Views files or stdin one screenful at a time.
Mounts a file system.
Displays networking information.
Keeps the date and time synchronized.
Displays processes selected by regex pattern.
Sends echo-request packets to network hosts.
Is a version of ping for IPv6 networks.
Sends a signal to processes selected by regex pattern.
Prints the given arguments according to the given format.
Shows list of processes.
Displays running processes as a tree.
Reads kernel profiling information.
Edits kernel routing tables.
Enters a system sleep state until specified wakeup time.
Finds the current and previous system runlevel.
Makes a typescript of a terminal session.
Plays back typescripts using timing information.
Filters and transforms text files in a single pass.
Changes reported architecture in a new program environment and sets personality flags.
Is an alias for ash.
Prints or checks SHA256 checksums.
Prints or checks SHA3-512 checksums.
Prints or checks SHA512 checksums.
Randomly permutes lines.
Sorts lines of text.
Sets or reports terminal line settings.
Runs a shell with substitute user ID.
Allows root to log in.
Prints checksum and block counts for each given file.
Disables devices for paging and swapping.
Enables devices for paging and swapping.
Logs the messages that system programs offer for logging.
Prints the last ten lines of each given file.
Creates, extracts, or lists files from a tar file.
Connects to telnet server.
Handles incoming telnet connections.
Compares values and checks file types.
Transfers a file from and to TFTP server.
Transfers a file on TFTP client's request.
Provides a view of process activity in real time.
Translates, squeezes, and deletes the given characters from standard input.
Traces the route to host.
Is a version of traceroute for IPv6 networks.
Converts spaces to tabs.
Decompresses files using the LZMA format.
Decompresses files using the XZ format.
Extract files from ZIP archive.
Prints the users currently logged on.
Edits files.
Locks a virtual terminal.
Writes contents of a file or standard input to all logged in users.
Runs a given command periodically.
Retrieves files via HTTP or FTP.
Queries WHOIS info about a domain name.
Compresses or decompresses files using the XZ format.
Decompresses XZ compressed files to standard output.
Decompresses gzipped files to standard output.
